highlights: Mothership is an open-source platform-as-a-service for deploying small applications.
Built a distributed multi-tenant architecture for deployed applications
Programmatically provisioned deployment-ready servers on DigitalOcean with Docker Machine
Implemented API calls to Docker Swarm to perform CRUD functions with containers on the remote manager machine
Utilised core web APIs to provide observability features for the PaaS
Leveraged WebSockets for providing service logs to users
Streamed application build output to web and CLI using Server Sent Events
Designed workflows and information architecture for the web application interface
Developed a variety of open source web applications using JavaScript, Node.js, Ruby, Ruby on Rails, SQL, HTML, CSS, and React.
Kanban: A project management app similar to Trello built with React/Redux and Rails
Grapevine: A social news and discussion application similar to Reddit built with Rails
Crossout: A task management application built with Nodejs, jQuery, and Handlebars
Collaborated with Disorient to design structures for Burning Man '17 & '18
Generated an urban plan for the Singularity Festival of Learning in collaboration with Jaaga
